page.title: 19Home Life - Survey Data cont
page.content: 2O% take the Radio &/or TV Times. Women's magazines and those covering many different hobbies were most popular. Hobbies pursued include sports but gardening, reading, knitting most popular. Village clubs for badminton & bowls well supported. Watching football, snooker, boxing, cricket, swimming and wrestling on TV popular in that order. 86% have TV, 77% telephones, 2O% videos and l3% home computers. Traditional foods such as roast meat, cheese and fish & chips are favourite, with wholefoods regain- ing popularity. Foreign foods favoured by few. Tea, coffee and soft drinks favoured by 5O%, wine spirits & beer by 3O%. Approx. 4O% attend church of some denomination fairly regularly. Villagers shop in adjacent market town of Bungay.Norwich also visited often by 5O%. See also p. 8.
